definition: to have guts/to have courage/to be brave
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be

sentences.english: An enormous heaviness was coming over me.
sentences.chinese: 我突然感到有種巨大的沉重感壓迫着我。

sentences.english: There's a falseness, a craftedness, but it's a kind of folk craftedness.
sentences.chinese: 有種虛僞和造作，但也是一種平易的造作。

sentences.english: There's a kind of unwritten law about what to wear.
sentences.chinese: 關於穿什麼有種不成文法。

sentences.english: There was a "dangerous cosiness" between the bank and Kenya's government.
sentences.chinese: 世行與肯尼亞政府之間總有種曖昧的“危險的默契”。

sentences.english: Yet something peculiar erupts when you've been around hip-hop for a while.
sentences.chinese: 但當你接觸了一段嘻哈樂後，你會有種奇怪的感覺。

sentences.english: A bit long perhaps but otherwise nonoffensive and kind of sweet.
sentences.chinese: 雖然可能有點長，但卻毫無惡意，反而有種溫馨感。

sentences.english: There is an interesting folktale about how the order of the 12 animals was determined.
sentences.chinese: 民間有種關於12生肖順序的有趣傳說。

sentences.english: Americans have always had an ambivalent attitude toward  intelligence.
sentences.chinese: 美國人對情報工作有種愛恨交織態度。

sentences.english: Is the person gutty what ill medicine is bad?
sentences.chinese: 人有種什麼病醫不好啊？

sentences.english: Looked at a bag of dried mango, I suddenly felt a kind of swindling.
sentences.chinese: 看着那一袋芒果乾，我突然間有種欺騙上當的感覺。

sentences.english: Probably endemic to the River Cross drainage in Cameroon.
sentences.chinese: 也許有種裏弗克羅斯在喀麥隆排水。

sentences.english: There is a new economy for writing.
sentences.chinese: 現在有種新經濟型寫作方法。

sentences.english: It reminds me of mountain skiing.
sentences.chinese: 這讓我有種高山滑雪的艱辛感。

sentences.english: You get that sense that people are working very hard there.
sentences.chinese: 你會有種感覺，那兒的人都非常努力地工作着。

sentences.english: Mouth looks a kind of unforgiving feeling.
sentences.chinese: 嘴巴看起來有種不饒人的感覺。

sentences.english: There is a concept in Taoism called ‘Wu Wei.’
sentences.chinese: 在道家學說裏有種理念叫做無爲。

definition: to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
this/this kind of/this sort of/this type of

that one/that thing/that (as opposed to this)/(used before a verb or adjective for emphasis)/(used to humorously or indirectly refer to sth embarrassing, funny etc, or when one can't think of the right word)/(used in speech as a filler, similar to "umm", "you know" etc)/(euph.) menstruation/sex/also pr. [nei4 ge5]
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
